sfChangesToday.newValue: 20/02 MF: Supporting them with the business case, technical validation and with merchant references. Started a rate review discussion. Catch up on 25/02

currentActionItems.question: Do we have specific quantifiable goals aligned with the project?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to follow up with Charlotte on projected GMV and cost analysis, and anchor specific KPIs in the business case.

currentActionItems.question: Do we understand the impact if this goal isn't achieved?

currentActionItems.notes: James Parker stated: 'every day we don't have a decision is costly to the project delivery.' Claire Curran: 'significant uplift in workload' for manua

currentActionItems.notes: Commerce Tools contract renewal. Board-level go/no-go decision referenced (Feb 4). Target of full launch by early next FY. Multiple references to tigh

currentActionItems.action: Validate if ~Feb 27 timeline is holding on Feb 25 catch-up.

currentActionItems.question: Have I identified the true economic buyer?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask Charlotte/Faye directly: 'Who at board level will make the final sign-off on this investment?'
currentActionItems.notes: Jay Jetley (CTO) is listed as Salesforce stakeholder. Faye Roth appears senior driving urgency. Charlotte Lecuyer is primary operational contact. True

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who's signing the contract?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'When we get to contract stage, who will be the signatory and what does your procurement process look like?'
currentActionItems.notes: No information about who specifically will sign the contract. Jay Jetley as CTO may have signing authority but this hasn't been confirmed.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have access to this individual?
currentActionItems.action: Request a brief executive alignment call with the EB to validate business case and timeline.
currentActionItems.notes: Jay Jetley was in early April calls but hasn't appeared in recent calls. Faye Roth attended Feb 4 and Jan 28 calls but exact title unknown. No direct

currentActionItems.question: Can we get access?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to request introduction to the final decision-maker, positioned as 'aligning on business case and timeline.'
currentActionItems.notes: Shopify has strong operational-level access. Faye may be able to facilitate EB access. Board go/no-go discussion suggests a path, but Shopify hasn't b

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what the economic buyer cares about most?
currentActionItems.action: Ask champion if CEO has additional/different criteria beyond James's priorities.
currentActionItems.notes: James Parker's priorities now clearer: (1) minimizing project delay cost, (2) total cost of ownership per architecture, (3) regional promotion flexibi

currentActionItems.question: Do you know how they make decisions and allocate budget?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to probe Charlotte/Faye on budget allocation process and competing investment priorities.
currentActionItems.notes: No evidence of understanding how budget is allocated, approval thresholds, or competing priorities. Jan 28 call mentioned Trinny is 'budget-conscious'

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how they will be making the decision?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'Can you walk me through what happens between now and a signed contract?'
currentActionItems.notes: Board-level go/no-go decision known. Technical validation and business case evaluation underway. Full end-to-end process from evaluation to vendor sel

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who's involved / buying committee?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to map the buying committee with Charlotte — who has a vote, who has a veto?
currentActionItems.notes: Good visibility into evaluation committee: Charlotte (ecommerce lead), Claire Curran (tax/finance), Rob Brown (technical/UX), Faye Roth (senior), Hite

currentActionItems.question: Do we know when they want to make a decision by?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to open Feb 25 call: 'James mentioned targeting a decision by end of this week — are we on track?'
currentActionItems.notes: James Parker stated: 'in the next one to two weeks we'll have a final decision' (from Feb 13 = ~Feb 27). Most concrete timeline commitment yet. Caveat

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what is driving this timeline?
currentActionItems.action: Confirm exact Commerce Tools renewal date.
currentActionItems.notes: Commerce Tools renewal driving timeline. Board-level pressure clear. Faye's urgency about stagnation. Target of early next FY launch.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what will happen if they do nothing?
currentActionItems.action: Include 'cost of inaction' analysis in next business case update.

currentActionItems.question: Have we surfaced technical complications (integrations)?
currentActionItems.action: Continue addressing technical questions through Ben Homer during Stephen's leave.
currentActionItems.notes: Extensively surfaced: tax systems (Avalara, Shopify Tax), payment processing (Adyen vs SP), HCL as implementation partner, headless vs headed architec

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how payments play into their decision?

currentActionItems.notes: SP with $49.4M GPV attached. Feb 4 call included SP rate discussion and revenue impact simulation. Maissa working on Adyen vs SP conversion rate compa

currentActionItems.question: Do we have a mutual action plan in place?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to draft a MAP and propose it during the Feb 25 catch-up.
currentActionItems.notes: No formal MAP or mutual close plan documented or agreed. Engagement has been reactive/organic.

currentActionItems.question: Did we help shape those criteria in our favour?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Charlotte/Faye: 'What is Commerce Tools proposing for renewal?'
currentActionItems.notes: Actively shaping through demos, business case, architecture recommendations (headed vs headless), SP positioning. However, Commerce Tools likely also

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who defined the decision criteria?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'Who put together the evaluation criteria for this platform decision?'
currentActionItems.notes: No evidence of who originally defined the evaluation criteria — IT/CTO, operations, board, or external consultant.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what their procurement process is?
currentActionItems.action: Complete rate review and map out full procurement/legal process with Trinny team.
currentActionItems.notes: [2026-02-25 SF refresh] Rate review discussion started — commercial/procurement process beginning.

currentActionItems.question: Are there likely to be redlines?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to proactively ask about legal review process and deal-breaker terms.
currentActionItems.notes: No information about legal review requirements. Given ~£60M turnover, they likely have legal review processes.

currentActionItems.question: If redlines, how long does review take?
currentActionItems.action: Include in procurement process discovery.
currentActionItems.notes: No information on legal review duration.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how long it will take?
currentActionItems.action: Include in procurement process discovery.
currentActionItems.notes: No information on overall procurement timeline from decision to signature.

currentActionItems.question: Do we have contract details?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to prepare preliminary contract scope/terms for when deal moves to Negotiate stage.
currentActionItems.notes: No contract details discussed. Deal is at Solution stage — contract hasn't been introduced yet.

currentActionItems.question: Have we sent the contract?
currentActionItems.action: Send contract once technical validation is complete and decision criteria are met.
currentActionItems.notes: Contract has not been sent. Deal is in Solution stage.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know target date for signature?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to work backwards from desired go-live to determine when contract needs to be signed.
currentActionItems.notes: SF close date is June 30, 2026. Merchant referenced 'early next FY' for go-live and board go/no-go process underway. No explicit target signature date

currentActionItems.question: Have they tried to resolve this issue in the past?
currentActionItems.action: Use this narrative in business case: 'You've seen both sides — here's what's changed on Shopify since you left.'
currentActionItems.notes: Previously migrated from Shopify to Commerce Tools headless, which was itself an attempt to solve limitations. Now evaluating moving back — previous s

currentActionItems.question: Do we know what teams are affected and to what extent?
currentActionItems.action: Ensure business case document reflects all 4 team impacts, not just engineering.
currentActionItems.notes: Pain now mapped across 4 teams: (1) Engineering — tech debt, slow dev, (2) Finance/Tax — manual VAT filing, workload (Claire, Feb 13), (3) Marketing/G

currentActionItems.question: Do we know how urgent it is to solve this pain?
currentActionItems.action: Include 'cost of 12-month delay' scenario in business case.

currentActionItems.question: Can they solve this pain using another option?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'What is Commerce Tools proposing for renewal?'
currentActionItems.notes: Commerce Tools renewal is the obvious alternative. No other vendors mentioned. CT renewal offer not known.

currentActionItems.question: Is our solution uniquely positioned to solve this pain?
currentActionItems.action: Ben Homer to follow up on Stephen's commitments to investigate VIP price list and advanced bundling solutions.
currentActionItems.notes: Well-positioned for unified commerce, lower TCO, faster migration (headed approach). SP is a differentiator. Gaps in native bundling, VIP pricing, and

currentActionItems.question: Does your champion have political capital and credibility?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to map org chart and understand reporting lines of key contacts.
currentActionItems.notes: Charlotte has operational credibility — coordinating evaluation, managing multiple teams. Faye has political capital — attended business case call, dr

currentActionItems.question: Have you been introduced to the decision maker?
currentActionItems.action: Ask Charlotte/Faye to introduce Maissa to the board-level decision-maker.
currentActionItems.notes: No evidence of direct introduction to true EB/board-level decision-maker. Jay Jetley (CTO) not in recent calls. Board go/no-go happened without Shopif

currentActionItems.question: Are they willing to bring you into the board/buying group?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to offer: 'Would it be helpful if we joined a brief session with your board?'
currentActionItems.notes: No evidence of invitation to present to board or buying group. Board go/no-go discussion happened internally.

currentActionItems.question: Why are they such a champion for you?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to conduct champion validation in 1:1 conversation.
currentActionItems.notes: Charlotte's motivation appears operational — dealing with daily platform pain. Faye's appears strategic — avoiding stagnation. Neither has explicitly

currentActionItems.question: Do we know who else the customer is evaluating?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'Beyond Shopify and Commerce Tools, are you evaluating any other platforms?'
currentActionItems.notes: Commerce Tools is clearly the incumbent/primary competition. Entire evaluation framed as 'Shopify vs Commerce Tools'. No other vendors mentioned. Have

currentActionItems.question: Have we asked if doing nothing is an option?
currentActionItems.action: Include in business case.
currentActionItems.notes: Staying on Commerce Tools (renewing) is explicitly an option. Board go/no-go was deciding whether to proceed with migration. Haven't deeply explored w

currentActionItems.question: Are there internal alternatives to our solution?
currentActionItems.action: Ask: 'Is Commerce Tools offering any changes to your architecture or renewal incentives?'
currentActionItems.notes: No discussion of internal alternatives (e.g., building on Commerce Tools, re-platforming internally). CT may be offering new architecture or incentive

currentActionItems.question: Do we know why alternatives are being evaluated?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask: 'What would Commerce Tools need to offer for you to stay? What concerns do you have about switching?'
currentActionItems.notes: Reasons they might stay on CT: switching cost fear, sunk cost, team familiarity, headless flexibility. These haven't been directly explored.

currentActionItems.question: Do we know why we would win or lose?
currentActionItems.action: Maissa to ask Charlotte/Faye: 'What would need to be true for you to choose Shopify?'
currentActionItems.notes: Win reasons: lower TCO, faster migration, unified commerce, SP economics. Loss risks: product gaps (bundling, VIP pricing), HCL inexperience, headless
